Posts.Content: Feeling much better now, on occasion feel some slight irritation in urethra. Working on prolonging the intervals between urination

Posts.Title: Bladder Spasm?

Posts.Content: Today, I am 3 weeks post op. Like the rest of you, my urine comes out strong and abruptly stops when empty. However, I seem to go quite often and sometimes after urination it still feels like I have to go. Is this fairly common?

Posts.Title: Bladder Spasm?

Posts.Content: Came home yesterday from Hospital (Sloan-Kettering). Had lessons on the catheter which I have to wear for 8 days. My issue now is that I feel so bloated post surgery. I was told to walk, which I did this morning about 20 minutes. I'm due for another walk now. Anyone have similar experience on how they overcame the bloat. I was given an explanation that my rectum was "asleep" after surgery and walking would help relieve gas. I'm still waiting. Thanks, Ralph
Posts.Title: Had RALP surgery wedenesday 5/28

Posts.Content: Thanks to you all for your advice. Getting redy to walk soon despite soreness.... Ralph
Posts.Title: Had RALP surgery wedenesday 5/28

Posts.Content: Thanks for the advice. I'm just about to go for my third walk of the day.(up and down the block I live on)

Posts.Title: Had RALP surgery wedenesday 5/28

Posts.Content: It is now about 2 weeks since my RALP surgery (5/28/14). I'm feeling much better and stronger. I walked a lot, and I'm resuming more normal activity(No sex as yet), I'm being careful not to "strain" on any activity. My post surgical biopsy report was good(no cancer out of the prostate). I am having a problem with urinary frequency. It seems to me that it's more frequent now without a prostate. My stream is strong. I do feel some slight irritation at the tip of my penis, but does not hurt when I urinate. I attribute this to the catheter I wore for 9 days. I am doing Kegel exercises Anyone have any advice about the frequency? Thanks

Posts.Title: 2 weeks post surgery

Posts.Content: I'm doing Kegel excercises at least 3x a day. Sometimes after a session it feels that I have to urinate more. But, thanks for the encouragement. Ralph

Posts.Title: 2 weeks post surgery

Posts.Content: Hello Group, I am very new having just been diagnosed with Prostate Cancer. My numbers for Gleason 3 cores+ with concentrations of 1%,5% and 40% all were 6(3+3). my DRE was negative. PSA went from 3.3 to 4.3 to 5.3 where it is currently. all cancerous cores were on 1 side. I had a CT scan today, no results as yet. I live in the NYC area. I'm a survivor of bladder cancer 3 and 1/2 years ago. I'm confused by choices of a)Watchful waiting b) Prostatectomy c)Radiation and which type. Thanks for any input.
Posts.Title: Newbie Just Diagnosd

Posts.Content: Dear Newporter, I'm looking forward to having a period of 4-5 hours between urination. For me it;s still about 1 and 1/2 hours. Thanks for encouragement

Posts.Content: Hello Bravehardon, Thanks for the response. My bowel complaints have just about stopped at this time. I guess I'll have to have some patience with the urinary frequency. Ralph

Posts.Title: Urinary Frequency

Posts.Content: I had my RALP surgery May 28th. I think I've made a good recovery, good surgical biopsy report etc. 1st post op PSA was 0.05. However I find myself urinating frequently, I had a urine test done and they found bacteria, I took Cipro for 7 days and it seemed to have cleared up. I was told that it may take some time for frequency to "clear" up due to the fact that the bladder has to become more elastic. I also note that there has been some changes in bowel habits as well becoming slightly more constipated. I wonder if there is a relationship between the two, Has anyone out there had any similar experiences? Thanks, Ralph

Posts.Title: Urinary Frequency

Posts.Content: I too had incision pain on the left side. I also had to lay down until the pain subsided. When I went back to my Doctor's office to remove the catheter, the nurse told me that this was one of the most common complaints among patients. I did a lot of walking and I'm now about 5 weeks post-op, pain is totally gone. I have been told to "have patience". That's tough sometimes. I wish you a speedy recovery.
